@Vlad Korobov Here is the WIP for the mute icon change from bell to speaker. Any feedback?

mute-light.png

mute-dark.png
In the light version it looks a bit different from other icons... transparency and color combination?

Yes thank you, I missed out on setting the default color of the svg to #333333 as used by texts and font icons. Here's a fixed version.

mute-light-fixedcolor.png

Nice! @Sayam Samal I updated the issue with the following note:

The icon needs to be replaced everywhere it occurs (not just the message header bar), including Recent topics, the settings menus and help center pages.
@Sayam Samal let me know when you have a PR up for this, and we can test-deploy it.
@Tim Abbott I'll be having a PR up for this really soon for test deployment.
@Tim Abbott @Alya Abbott PR #21839 is up for test-deployment, accommodating the necessary changes.

Cool, thanks! The screenshots in the PR are very helpful.

I guess this icon is quite wide, which is a bit challenging. For example, I think it looks a bit funny in the stream three-dot menu, where it's noticeably wider than the other icons on the list.

163861493-b2d35269-5f34-47ae-8a80-2552c900ab16.png
@Vlad Korobov could you review the PR when you get a chance, and comment on how you'd like to proceed? Should we make any changes, or test-deploy here as it currently is?

I guess this icon is quite wide, which is a bit challenging. For example, I think it looks a bit funny in the stream three-dot menu, where it's noticeably wider than the other icons on the list.

I noticed this peculiarity as well while working on this, one reason for this is that actual content of the font-awesome icons contained in the :before pseudo element are less wider than the <i> tags which contains them, for example in the above mention by @Alya Abbott the plus icon is only 11px wide centered inside a 14px wide <i> tag v/s the 14px wide mute icon.

Attaching an image for more clarity.
icon widths

Screenshots are good enough to me. I don't think we should bother a lot about little misalignments. I don't think we should convert all svg icons to a font since we need precise control over size and alignment. I suggest to have icons as js components which would inline svg icons in the dom. If you want to use svg as files and link to those files from the css it's also ok. I guess embedding svg as a string in css or base64 is less preferred since its harder to manage (it does help with initial speed of loading)
So PR is good to me and I suggest to move forward. And if in the redesigned version of screens this icon will not look good we will tune that later
Cool, I'm happy to have #21839 test-deployed here, then. @Tim Abbott over to you for review/deployment.

@Vlad Korobov we could move to a SVG icon system by using SVG sprites. This looks promising to me as it allows for individual styling anywhere the icon is used while also allowing for reusability.

I'm linking some articles for reference,

  1. https://css-tricks.com/svg-sprites-use-better-icon-fonts/
  2. https://www.ianfeather.co.uk/ten-reasons-we-switched-from-an-icon-font-to-svg/
I didn't use svg sprites before, so can't tell how easy it is to work with.
This change was finally integrated today! Folks should definitely comment if they see anything weird/misaligned with mute icons.
